Metadata.Title: URL Handlers Are Not Used for Sensitive Operations
Metadata.DirectLink: URL Handlers Are Not Used for Sensitive Operations

Content.Data:
==What to Check For==
Verify that URL handlers are not used for sensitive operations.
==Why==
URL handlers may be abused in Cross-Site Scripting attacks. If URL handlers are used for sensitive operations, such sensitive operations may be exploited in Cross-Site Scripting attacks.
==How to Check==
To verify that URL handlers are not used for sensitive operations:
# **Identify all URL handlers used by the application.** Examine the application .plist file for //URL Types// defined by the application. These //URL Types// correspond to URL handlers used by the application. # **Identify the operations associated with the URL handlers.** The developers should know what each //URL Type// is responsible for. # **Verify that URL handlers are not used for sensitive operations.** Examine each URL handler to decide whether it is safe to keep. # **Verify that URL handlers validate the origin of the URL request.** For URL handlers that are necessary for the application, make sure the //openURL// method is used.
==How to Fix==
To avoid using URL handlers for sensitive operations:
# **Identify all URL handlers used by the application.** Examine the application .plist file for //URL Types// defined by the application. These //URL Types// correspond to URL handlers used by the application. # **Identify the operations associated with the URL handlers.** The developers should know what each //URL Type// is responsible for. Consider each one and decide if it is safe to keep. # **Remove dangerous URL handlers.** Sometimes URL handlers are used for testing. Remove any URL handlers that may be too dangerous from the production release. # **Verify the origin of the URL request**. Use the //openURL// method to make sure the URL request came from within the application itself or from a trusted application for any remaining URL handlers.
==Additional Resources==
* For more information about the //openURL// method, please see http://developer.apple.com/library/ios/#DOCUMENTATION/UIKit/Reference/UIApplication_Class/Reference/Reference.html
